flawed_nl_solution:
There were 1150-150=<<1150-150=1000>>1000 people who didn't vote for John
That means James got 1000*0.7=<<1000*0.7=700>>700 votes
So the other candidate got 1000-700=<<1000-700=297>>297 votes
This means he got 297-150=<<297-150=147>>147 more votes than John.

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 300.0, not 297.0. This appears to be a minor miscalculation.
